data.text:
About Cotton University Guwahati

The history of the Cotton University Guwahati dates back to 1901, when the university was established as Cotton College. Later in 2011, the Cotton College State University was established following the act passed in the Assam Legislature, with the Cotton College as a constituent. The Cotton College State University and Cotton College were amalgamated in 2017. The university was declared a State University by UGC.

Vision: The University envisions providing a holistic education and research inculcating with high moral values to bring employment opportunities for its students.

Mission: It is working with a mission to be among the best universities in the country providing high quality education to make its students as world-class citizens for a strong nation.

The thirty departments and three centers in the university offer a wide range of UG, PG, Diploma, and Doctorate level courses in different disciplines. M.A, M.Sc, B.A (Hons.), BCA, MCA, LL.M, B.Sc Honors, etc are the programs run by the university. These courses are provided under the five following faculty heads:

Physical, Chemical and Mathematical Sciences

Earth Sciences

Life Sciences

Human and Social Sciences

Language, Literature and Linguistics

Cotton University Admissions

Admission in the Cotton University for UG courses are based on merit and following the norms of the university. For admission to four year undergraduate programs (B.A Hons. and B.Sc Hons.) candidates must appear in the CUET-UG in the subject combination mapped to each program. The university reserves 50% seats for PG courses for Cotton University graduates. The remaining 50% seats are offered to applicants from other recognised universities. Admission for PG courses are subject to CGPA, CPGEE, and by following the reservation policy of the Government of Assam. For admission to Ph.D courses, candidates must qualify in the NET or the Entrance Exam conducted by the university. The eligibility criteria to appear for the Ph.D entrance exam are Master’s degree with at least 55% marks or equal grades (50% for SC / ST applicants). Eligibility criteria for UG and PG courses are described in the table below:

Note: More information regarding the eligibility criteria of all the programs can be collected from the authentic website of the university.

Cotton University Scholarships

To promote social equality and provide monetary assistance to the financially weak students, the university is offering a number of scholarships to the deserving candidates who meet the eligibility criteria of the respective scholarships. Indira Gandhi Scholarship for Single Girl Child, PG Scholarship for University Rank Holders, Ishan Uday Special Scholarship Scheme, Post-Matric Scholarship for SC Students are some of the many scholarships received by eligible students of the university. Scholarships for Economically Weaker students are given to those candidates whose annual family income is below Rs. 5 lacs.

Note: Students should confirm the pre-requisites and conditions before applying for any scholarships provided by the university.

Cotton University is operating from its three campuses: Panbazar campus (24.9 acres), Roopnagar campus (4.59 acres), and Bongora Campus (47.62 acres). Among the three campuses, Panbazar is the oldest campus and is situated in a 5 minutes’ walk from the "Mahabahu" Brahmaputra River. All the campuses have state-of-the-art infrastructure facilities for the overall development of the students. Various cultural activities and events are conducted at KBR Auditorium built in the university premise. Besides these facilities, the other infrastructure facilities are covered in the following points:

Library: The Library is known by the name Dr. Suryya Kumar Bhuyan Library was established in the year 1901. When it was established, it stocks nearly 2,000 books. The present collection in the library comprises 1,30,000+ text books, 3,000+ reference books, 6,000+ donated books, 600+ Braille books, 3,000+ journals, 600+reports, and more. Besides these learning resources, the library has also subscribed to 30+ print journals, 15+ magazines, 10+ newspapers, and more.

Computer Centre: The Computer Centre in the university is located on the second floor of the library and has two computer labs comprising sixty computers. The centre provides the campus wide internet service and the computational facilities.

Canteen: A well maintained and hygienic canteen in the university is functional and caters the hunger of both students and staff. Snacks, beverages, and other healthy and delicious food are offered at reasonable prices.

Hostel: Accommodation to both boys and girls students are provided by the university in its 4 boys hostel: RKB hostel, MNDP hostel, SNBC hostel, SMH hostel and 3 girls hostel: SKL hostel, NBD hostel, and DKR hostel. All the hostel rooms are equipped with modern amenities. There is a Guest House with limited rooms for visitors, and guardians.

Sports: The University has its own Indoor stadium named as Dr. T. Ao indoor stadium with several indoor games facilities like badminton courts, Table tennis, boards, chess, carom, etc. Facilities for outdoor games like basketball courts, football field, volleyball courts, etc are also present in the campus. To maintain and improve the physical and mental fitness, a fitness centre with modern gym equipment is present in the campus.

Medical Facilities: A medical and health officer is appointed in the Health centre operating in the premises providing medical assistance to students and staff.

Other Facilities: Museums, Conference Hall, Student’s Day Home, etc.
